TestDescription.name: Zabbix SQL injection
TestDescription.Description:
Zabbix is the ultimate open source availability and performance monitoring solution. SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported an SQL injection vulnerability in Zabbix versions <= 2.0.8. [break][break]
By exploiting this SQL injection vulnerability, an authenticated attacker (or guest user) is able to gain full access to the database. This causes a privilege escalation to power users as well as a possible compromise of the database and operating system the database is running on.[break][break]
Because of the functionalities Zabbix offers, an attacker with admin privileges could be able (depending on the actual configuration) to execute arbitrary OS commands on the configured Zabbix hosts. This results in a severe impact to the monitored infrastructure.[break][break]
Although the attacker needs to be authenticated in general, the system could also be at risk if the adversary has no user account. Zabbix offers a guest mode which provides a low privileged default account for users without password. If this guest mode is enabled, the SQL injection vulnerability can be exploited unauthenticated.
TestDescription.Impact: The vulnerabilities allow an attacker to gain access to the database and execute arbitrary SQL statements.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to the latest version or apply the patches provided by vendor.

Reference.database: SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab Security Advisory 20131004-0
SQL injection vulnerabilities in the API and frontend
